name: Agentic AI
notes: Autonomous AI systems on the Peak of Inflated Expectations. Focus is shifting from GenAI to the complexity of Agent Governance.

name: Generative AI
notes: Has moved into the Trough of Disillusionment as organizations struggle to prove ROI beyond initial content creation use cases.

name: AI-Augmented Software Engineering
notes: AI copilots and autonomous testing/deployment tools are proving value and scaling adoption.

name: Multiagent Systems
notes: The foundational concept behind Agentic AI, sharing its high-hype, low-maturity position.

name: Post-Quantum Cryptography (PQC)
notes: Urgency is high due to the 'Harvest Now, Decrypt Later' risk, with material risk expected within five years.

name: Quantum Computing
notes: The 'Year of Quantum' in 2025 emphasizes strategic planning for hybrid solutions; practical utility is 5-10 years out.

name: Spatial Computing
notes: Driven by new hardware releases, expectations are high, but consumer adoption hurdles remain.

name: Sustainable IT (GreenOps)
notes: Practices like GreenOps and cloud optimization (serverless, containerization) are becoming standard and mandatory.

name: Digital Immune Systems
notes: Combining AI, observability, and resilience testing to create self-healing, fault-tolerant enterprise systems.

name: Confidential Computing
notes: Hardware-based security for data-in-use, seeing broad adoption across cloud providers for sensitive workloads.

name: Cyber-Physical Systems
notes: Operational systems (OT) integrated with IT, driving smart factories and critical infrastructure.

name: Verifiable Credentials (VCs)
notes: Core component of Decentralized Identity, with adoption accelerating due to regulatory pushes (e.g., EU eIDAS).

name: Synthetic Data
notes: Value proven for privacy and testing, but struggles with fidelity and acceptance in regulatory contexts.

name: Digital Humans
notes: Moving out of peak hype as realism and scalability challenges become apparent.

name: AI-Ready Data
notes: At the Peak of Inflated Expectations, as organizations realize existing data is insufficient for scaled AI.

name: Federated Learning
notes: Scaling in use cases where privacy (e.g., healthcare, mobile) prevents centralized data pooling.

name: Intelligent Applications
notes: Established applications enhanced with embedded AI/ML to automate tasks and improve user experience.

name: Low-Earth Orbit Comms (LEO)
notes: Moving past peak; focus is on terrestrial integration and cost reduction, not just coverage.

name: Advanced Robotics
notes: Advanced manipulation and mobile robotics for logistics and manufacturing are maturing rapidly.

name: Commercial Space Tech
notes: Expansion of private capabilities for remote sensing, satellite services, and logistics.

name: 6G Networks
notes: Fundamental research phase; concepts like AI-driven infrastructure and massive connectivity are emerging.

name: Superapps
notes: Proven concept in Asia, but facing integration and regulatory hurdles in Western markets.

name: GitOps
notes: A standard, mature practice for managing Kubernetes and cloud infrastructure via version control.

name: Decentralized Identity (DID)
notes: Maturing rapidly, driven by European regulations and the need for user-centric, privacy-preserving identity management.
